main event: Corporal Lertis E. Stanfield observed an unusual aerial phenomenon at Datil, New Mexico on February 24-25, 1950.
interesting points: Stanfield observed the object at 1930 hours on February 24 and again at 0200 hours on February 25, with the object remaining in view for around 1.5 hours each time.
The object appeared white, changing to red and green in color, and was described as circular or round in shape.
Photographs of the object were taken by Stanfield, numbered 1 to 5, but they were not included in the provided image.
The object moved in a straight line northwest, at an estimated speed of 10 degrees per 2 minutes on the azimuth, with no visible signs of exhaust or sound.
The object disappeared from view at 2200 hours on February 24 and reappeared in almost the same position the next morning at 0200 hours.
sighted object: a white, circular object that changed to red and green colors
photographs: yes, the report indicates that 5 photographs were taken but not included in the provided image
